required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neo-nervegenesis in Inguinal Hernia Implant ProFlor
clinical_study.official_title: Neo-neurogenesis in 3D Dynamic Responsive Implant for Inguinal Hernia Repair PorFlor

brief_summary.textblock: The investigation is aimed at specifically demonstrating the ingrowth of newly formed nervous elements within a 3D dynamic responsive implant for inguinal hernia repair.

detailed_description.textblock: Biopsy specimen were excised at defined postoperative stages from patients who underwent hernia repair with the 3D prosthesis named ProFlor. Scope of the study was to determine the presence, quantity and quality of the neural ingrowth within the implant fabric. Histology revealed the presence of multiple nerve clusters that, starting from the early stage post-implantation, increased in number and degree of maturation. In the long term, neural elements assumed the typical aspect of normal nervous structures complete in all components. The development of highly specialized tissue such as nerves, together with other components of the abdominal wall already described in literature, seems to finalize a regenerative response. This kind of behavior, being the expected result from a device intended for the cure of inguinal hernia and its degenerative source, seems to be coherent with the pathogenesis of the disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Ingrowth of Newly Formed Nervous Elements Within Hernia Implant ProFlor
primary_outcome.description: Post-operative assessment of neonervegenesis within hernia implant ProFlor at short, mid and long term post-implantation

arm_group.arm_group_label: Short term post inguinal hernia repair wit ProFlor
arm_group.description: Determining presence and level of maturation of nervous structures in the hernia implant named ProFlor at 3-5 weeks post implantation

arm_group.arm_group_label: Mid term post inguinal hernia repair wit ProFlor
arm_group.description: Determining presence and level of maturation of nervous structures in the hernia implant named ProFlor at 3-4 months post implantation

intervention.arm_group_label: Long term post inguinal hernia repair wit ProFlor
Mid term post inguinal hernia repair wit ProFlor
Short term post inguinal hernia repair wit ProFlor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who underwent inguinal hernia repair with the prosthetic device named ProFlor
- Patients undergoing recurrent inguinal hernia repair after primary repair with the prosthetic device named ProFlor
- Patients undergoing surgical procedure in the groin area after inguinal hernia repair with the prosthetic device named ProFlor
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who underwent inguinal hernia repair with conventional flat meshes

reference.citation: Amato G, Lo Monte AI, Cassata G, Damiano G, Romano G, Bussani R. A new prosthetic implant for inguinal hernia repair: its features in a porcine experimental model. Artif Organs. 2011 Aug;35(8):E181-90. doi: 10.1111/j.1525-1594.2011.01272.x. Epub 2011 Jul 13.

Amato G, Romano G, Agrusa A, Marasa S, Cocorullo G, Gulotta G, Goetze T, Puleio R. Biologic response of inguinal hernia prosthetics: a comparative study of conventional static meshes versus 3D dynamic implants. Artif Organs. 2015 Jan;39(1):E10-23. doi: 10.1111/aor.12416.

Amato G, Romano G, Puleio R, Agrusa A, Goetze T, Gulotta E, Gordini L, Erdas E, Calò P. Neomyogenesis in 3D Dynamic Responsive Prosthesis for Inguinal Hernia Repair. Artif Organs. 2018 Dec;42(12):1216-1223. doi: 10.1111/aor.13286. Epub 2018 Oct 14.

results_reference.citation: Amato G, Agrusa A, Puleio R, Calò P, Goetze T, Romano G. Neo-nervegenesis in 3D dynamic responsive implant for inguinal hernia repair. Qualitative study. Int J Surg. 2020 Apr;76:114-119. doi: 10.1016/j.ijsu.2020.02.046. Epub 2020 Mar 10.

reported_events.desc: All participant underwent biopsy from the implanted prosthesis. Being the prosthesis positioned in the inguinal area outside of the abdominal cavity, this minimally invasive procedure produces no risks of mortality. Also risks for serious adverse events are nullified because the tissue removal do not involve any vital organs

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
